ch.se.inf.ethz.jcd.batman.vdisk.impl

Class VirtualDisk

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.se.inf.ethz.jcd.batman.vdisk.impl.VirtualDisk
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IVirtualDisk, Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public final class VirtualDisk
extends Object
implements IVirtualDisk
    Implementation of IVirtualDisk The VirtualDisk needs at least 192(superblock) + 128(root directory entry) byte to store its meta data. The first 192 byte are structured as follows: 0x00 8byte MagicNumber 0x08 8byte Root Directory offset 0x10 8byte Position of additional disk information 0x18 168byte FreeLists The first entry after the free lists is usually the root directory. But because there is an offset saved in the superblock which gives the offset of the root directory, it could also be saved in another place. The VirtualDisk will dynamically increase the underlying file and add the new space to the free lists. Which are used when new IDataBlock need to be allocated.

      • file

      • rootDirectory

        private IVirtualDirectory rootDirectory

      • freeLists

        private final List<Long> freeLists
        Holds the offset position of the start of each free list. The free lists are handled as follows: FreeListIndex : Size of blocks in the free list 1 : 128*2^0-128*2^1 - 1 2 : 128*2^1-128*2^2 - 1 ... 21 : 128*2^21-infinity

      • path

        private final String path

      • allocateBlock

        public IDataBlock[] allocateBlock(long dataSize)
                           throws IOException
        Allocates IDataBlock to store the number of bytes given by size. The blocks are returned as an array and internally linked with a linked list. Which means the first block has set next to the second block and so on.
        Specified by:
        allocateBlock in interface IVirtualDisk
        Parameters:
        dataSize - the number of bytes the data blocks have to be able to store
        Returns:
        the allocated blocks
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
